data: If patient is an inpatient please complete the CARD Inpatient Pre Cardiac Procedure PowerPlan
RN to Initiate the Pre Procedure phase of this plan
If patient is unable to give informed consent, please arrange for a family member/legal guardian to accompany patient to the department. Consent must be obtained by a physician
Pregnancy testing for women of childbearing age
18g or 20g on the left arm preferred
order rate: 25 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
If patient is on heparin IV infusion discontinue heparin on arrival to cardiac catheterization lab
dose range: 2 to 5 mg, IV, q5min, PRN other (see comment)
25 mcg, IV, q15min, PRN pain, drug form: inj
1 mg, sublingual, q4h, PRN anxiety, drug form: tab-sublingual
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, PO, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: tab
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, IV, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
0.5 mg, IV, as directed, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
If patient on warfarin and INR not done in previous 24 hours
Consider collecting bloodwork at time of procedure if required
Blood, Routine, Unit collect, Collected, Collection: T;N, once
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
Blood, Routine, Unit collect, Collected, Collection: T;N, once
Liver Panel (Bilirubin, ALP, Alb, ALT, GGT)
Blood, Routine, Unit collect, Collected, Collection: T;N, once
Lipid Panel (Chol, Trig, HDL, LDL, Non-HDL)
Blood, Routine, Unit collect, Collected, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Routine, Unit collect, Collected, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Routine, Unit collect, Collected, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Routine, Unit collect, Collected, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Routine, Unit collect, Collected, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Routine, Unit collect, Collected, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Timed, Unit collect, Collected, once
Blood, Timed, Unit collect, Collected, once
Blood, Routine, Unit collect, Collected, Collection: T;N, once
If not done in the previous 7 days
If/when recurrent ischemic symptoms or arrhythmias present, then RN to place order for Electrocardiogram 12 Lead STAT
Provide supplemental oxygen to patients who have SpO2 less than 92%, breathlessness, signs of heart failure, or shock
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 88 - 92 %, Nasal Cannula, up to 6 L/min, for known CO2 retainers
Reason for Consult: Patient requires full face mask
Send patients own dentures, hearing aid and glasses to the Catheterization Lab pre procedure
If patient is on IV Heparin or Femoral puncture performed, complete CARD Cardiac Catheterization (Angiogram) and PCI (Angioplasty) Post Procedure PowerPlan
Initiate appropriate cardiology inpatient admission orders if patient is to be admitted
RN to Initiate the Post Procedure phase of this plan
RN to discontinue the Pre Procedure Phase of the CARD Cardiac Biopsy (Multiphase) PowerPlan
Discharge patient once hemostasis is achieved or vital signs completed
q15 min for 1 hour, then q30 min for 1 hour
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
Until 1 hour post hemostasis of site
Until 1 hour post hemostasis of site
Start: NPO, Advance/Adjust to: General Diet, Start diet 1 hour post hemostasis of site
Start: NPO, Advance/Adjust to: Diabetes Diet, Start diet 1 hour post hemostasis of site
